tweet: My grandma's #LTC facility has stopped publishing the number of confirmed cases of #Covid_19 on their site.  Per the last update, it was confined to one building that my grandma isn't in.  They seem to be doing everything right. But we don't KNOW.   We need #transparency!

Of Canada's 3184 COVID-19-related deaths, I've linked 2631 of them to residential care (LTC, RH, Rehab, adult residential homes, one jail). That's 82,6% of all death in Canada!   The lack of info in Quebec is growing even wider:  https://t.co/rtxyvfFyff

“I haven’t seen him for 3 weeks”  “I drop off food but she won’t eat it unless I’m there”  “They don’t understand her as she doesn’t speak English”  Restrictions on family caregivers in #LTC can’t continue forever. As #COVID19 stretches on, we must find a better way forward.

I'm calling for better care and safer work in long-term care, now. #COVID19Canada only made the issues in LTC clear. @fordnation, make wage increases permanent & increase FT work, improve infection control and implement a 4-hour care standard. #FixLTCFord #onpoli #canlab #unifor  https://t.co/Fxq36Byqx0
